summary: Climate assessments predict that floods and other extreme weather events will become more common and intense, putting coastal areas—which are home to more than half of the U.S. population—at risk. The wetlands, marshes, and mangroves that usually help protect coastal communities are also vulnerable. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration provides funding, training, and other assistance to help states assess and prepare their coastal zones...
title: Climate Change: Information on NOAA's Support for States' Marine Coastal Ecosystem Resilience Efforts
